feed.title: Event
feed.subtitle: All items in Space Schedule > Event.

entry.title: CRS-23 Dragon Undocking
entry.content: The SpaceX CRS-23 Dragon spacecraft will undock from the International Space Station ahead of its reentry, splashdown and recovery.

entry.title: Russian EVA-50
entry.content: Roscosmos cosmonauts Oleg Novitskiy and Pyotr Dubrov will exit the International Space Station through the Poisk airlock to continue establishing external cable connections between the new MLM Nauka module and the Zvezda module.

entry.title: Russian EVA-49
entry.content: Roscosmos cosmonauts Oleg Novitskiy and Pyotr Dubrov will exit the International Space Station through the Poisk airlock to establish external cable connections between the new MLM Nauka module and the Zvezda module.

entry.title: CRS-23 Dragon Docking
entry.content: Following its launch atop a Falcon 9, the CRS-23 Dragon will autonomously dock to the ISS, bringing crew supplies as well as experiments.

entry.title: Boeing Starliner OFT 2 Landing
entry.content: Following its deorbit burn, the Boeing CST-100 Starliner will reenter the Earth's atmosphere and land at the White Sands Missile Range using its parachutes.

entry.title: Boeing Starliner OFT 2 Docking
entry.content: The Boeing CST-100 Starliner will dock with the International Space Station as part of its second uncrewed test flight.

entry.title: Boeing Starliner OFT 2 Undocking
entry.content:
The Boeing CST-100 Starliner will undock from the International Space Station and conduct a deorbit burn as part of its second uncrewed test flight.
Following the deorbit burn the capsule will renter the Earth's atmosphere and land at the 'White Sands Missile Range' using its parachutes.

entry.title: US EVA-77
entry.content: NASA astronaut Mark Vande Hei and JAXA astronaut Akihiko Hoshide will venture outside the orbiting outpost to perform maintenance tasks and activate the Bartolomeo platform on the exterior of the Columbus module.

entry.title: Boeing Starliner OFT-2 Update
entry.content: NASA and Boeing are continuing discussions on the status of the Orbital Flight Test-2 (OFT-2) mission, and will host a joint media teleconference at 1 p.m. EDT, Friday, Aug. 13, to discuss the second uncrewed flight of Boeing’s CST-100 Starliner spacecraft to the International Space Station, as part of the agency’s Commercial Crew Program.
